pre_attack: What is the punishment for making or possessing a subversive document under the Criminal Law (Temporary Provisions) Act 1955?

Any person who, without lawful excuse, makes, causes to be made, carries or has in his possession or under his control any subversive document shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to imprisonment for a term not exceeding 10 years.

The penalty for making, causing to be made, carrying, or having in possession or control of any subversive document under the Criminal Law (Temporary Provisions) Act 1955 is **imprisonment for a term not exceeding 10 years**.   ##3$$

Here's why:

* The act clearly states that anyone who makes, causes to make, carries, or has such a document in their possession or control without lawful excuse will be guilty of an offense.
* This punishment applies regardless of whether the person was aware of the nature and contents of the subversive document they made.
